text:
This doesn't look good, TPD has been a step change in making inplay more efficient..

To put in context the loss of 0.004 of ev results in a halving of profits for this particular strategy

elements.text:

text: This mirrors what I have felt for a while now - without a shred of evidence I might add. Just a gut feel based on change in markets. I've had to adjust almost all my GPS based strats to stay afloat.

elements.text: This mirrors what I have felt for a while now - without a shred of evidence I might add. Just a gut feel based on change in markets. I've had to adjust almost all my GPS based strats to stay afloat.

text: Yeah I was contemplating rerunning my model code to try and improve it but I doubt it will make a difference, just seems to come down to more competition / more efficient markets. I was 25% down in 2022 compared to 2021 and tbh I would be happy to match 2022 in 23 but its not going to be easy / not sure I can be bothered :joy:

text: Are you able to test non-GPS markets against GPS markets for IP generic strategies ? I do some stuff on all IP horses but my non-GPS strats are poor fare in comparison. I know you do well across the board IP regardless so maybe you have seen a drop off in the ATR tracks due to GPS data? Like a case-control type thing.

I know you do well across the board IP regardless so maybe you have seen a drop off in the ATR tracks due to GPS data? Like a case-control type thing.

text: Ah ok I'll revisit that one then

text: I don't know how to test it but it feels like the GPS markets are a lot more "static" now - especially in the early race stages. I find it hard to believe that this is down to BA users via manual trading - it feels like someone has a half decent model for ALL stages of the race now which it never felt like before. I've stopped trying to refine my GPS stuff now really just try to be more selective on entry points.

elements.text: I don't know how to test it but it feels like the GPS markets are a lot more "static" now - especially in the early race stages. I find it hard to believe that this is down to BA users via manual trading - it feels like someone has a half decent model for ALL stages of the race now which it never felt like before. I've stopped trying to refine my GPS stuff now really just try to be more selective on entry points.

text: Interesting, I am not to involved in the early stuff but had to get creative with where I find value, I am super aggressive in my bets, there was a few days last year where I stopped to gather some data and it has become very interesting in analysing my impact

elements.text: Interesting, I am not to involved in the early stuff but had to get creative with where I find value, I am super aggressive in my bets, there was a few days last year where I stopped to gather some data and it has become very interesting in analysing my impact

text: Is that EV after fees? How come a 0.004 decrease halves profits, premium charge?

elements.text: Is that EV after fees? How come a 0.004 decrease halves profits, premium charge?

text: I suppose if you are a large player from a volume perspective thats a great tool at your disposal. It feels like a mystery to me as I will probably replay at least half of the GPS markets visually in sync with the price feed and the GPS still has a LOT of measurement error - particularly with motion perpendicular to the racing line. I've reached a point now where I spend my time looking at non-GPS IP strats and PE stuff now. Feels like the ROI (from a time / productivity perspective) on GPS stuff has dropped off a cliff for me.

text:
This best describes what I found with TPD :
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunction_fallacy>
(Daniel Kahneman), The Linda problem. I found i was doing OK with it, but better without including it in the mix

attachments.text: The conjunction fallacy (also known as the Linda problem) is an inference from an array of particulars, in violation of the laws of probability, that a conjoint set of two or more conclusions is likelier than any single member of that same set. It is a type of formal fallacy.
attachments.title: Conjunction fallacy

elements.text: This best describes what I found with TPD :
(Daniel Kahneman), The Linda problem. I found i was doing OK with it, but better without including it in the mix

text: How where you applying it? From scratch or with your current strategies?

elements.text: How where you applying it? From scratch or with your current strategies?

text: I was trying to use it initially from scratch. The majority of times it worked well, it was just those occasions where the data wasnt accurate. At one point (as a trial) i used the reverse logic, Ie I placed orders opposite to what the signals were telling me. I lost quite a few as you would imagine, but on those occasions as mentioned above I made the losses back. That when I realised that it was hindering me rather than assisting me :grinning:

elements.text: I was trying to use it initially from scratch. The majority of times it worked well, it was just those occasions where the data wasnt accurate. At one point (as a trial) i used the reverse logic, Ie I placed orders opposite to what the signals were telling me. I lost quite a few as you would imagine, but on those occasions as mentioned above I made the losses back. That when I realised that it was hindering me rather than assisting me

text: There are so many catches that you need to accomodate for with the GPS. If it soulds like I am moaning about it I am not - its made me profit where I had none before. But there really are a lot of gotchas that come from unusual places at times. I can see for sure how you could get your fingers burned using it for an angle near the line as I've seen "winners" by 10 metres that actually came 4th in reality.

elements.text: There are so many catches that you need to accomodate for with the GPS. If it soulds like I am moaning about it I am not - its made me profit where I had none before. But there really are a lot of gotchas that come from unusual places at times. I can see for sure how you could get your fingers burned using it for an angle near the line as I've seen "winners" by 10 metres that actually came 4th in reality.
